paper_abstract: We discuss the effect of low-frequency noise on interacting superconducting qubits in a fixed coupling scheme. By properly choosing operating conditions, within the adiabatic framework the systems develops two decoupled subspaces. The subspace where a SWAP operation takes place turns out to be resilient to low frequency fluctuations. The possibility to encode a single qubit in a protected two-physical-qubit system subspace is briefly discussed.
paper_title: Protected computational subspaces of coupled superconducting qubits
